0.user_question: For a New Year's resolution, Andy wants to lose 7547401 lbs. by his birthday, which is July 19th. Today is December 31st. If Andy needs to burn 3500 calories to lose a pound, how much of a calorie deficit (net amount of calories burned vs. calories consumed) does he need each day to reach his goal?

1.subquestion: Starting from today until his birthday on July 19th is approximately equal to how many days exactly?

subanswer.text: From January 1st till February 1st inclusive is about one month or roughly 31 days; similarly, June ends on the same date hence its duration will be considered full months too. Adding up all these durations results in a count of 31(January)+28(February)+31(March)+30(April)+31(May)+19(June). This totals out to be 160 days. But since tomorrow is already counted i.e., Dec 31st, subtract 1 thus resulting in an exact span of ~159 days between now and next year’s Jan first. To calculate daily net calorie requirement under constant conditions without considering other factors like weight gain during holidays etc.: Caloric Deficit=(Total Weight Loss Desired*Calories per Pound)/Duration Until Birthday=((7547401)*3500)/159≈DBL+TBD [where DBL stands for Daily Baseline Level & TBD represents 'To Be Determined']. In simpler terms though—Andy would ideally require burning nearly double current human bodyweight worth energy every single calendar day just based solely upon our existing scientific understanding! 1.subquestion: Starting from today until his birthday on July 19th is approximately equal to how many days exactly?

subanswer.text: From January 1st till February 1st inclusive is about one month or roughly 31 days; similarly, June ends on the same date hence its duration will be considered full months too. Adding up all these durations results in a count of 31(January)+28(February)+31(March)+30(April)+31(May)+19(June). This totals out to be 160 days. But since tomorrow is already counted i.e., Dec 31st, subtract 1 thus resulting in an exact span of ~159 days between now and next year’s Jan first.
